  • Surge damage makes mechanical or assisted limbs count as broken and nonfunctional.
  • Surge damage has special interactions with the mechanical heart and eyes.
  • EMP damage is no longer randomized. It is now much more consistent.
  • IPC battery is no longer represented as nutrition. Instead, the microbattery organ contains a super-capacity cell that is used for all their actions. This is represented with a new HUD icon.
  • Hardsuits can now be charged in robot chargers if you are wearing them.
  • Ion bolts now have a hit sound.
  • Removed the ion rifle lethal mode.
  • The ion rifle now has four shots.
  • EMP'd guns no longer get discharged. Instead, they lock up for an amount of time depending on the strength of the EMP.

MoondancerPony updated:

  • Fixes the changelog.
  • Prevents uses of < and >, particularly when referencing things like <style> tags, from breaking changelogs in the future.

18 December 2020

Furrycactus updated:

  • AI and Stationbounds can no longer select Republican Siik as an accent.

Wowzewow (Wezzy) updated:

  • Fixes invisible remote control chairs.
  • Fixes detective badge job whitelists in the loadout.

17 December 2020

Furrycactus, Ferner, Happy_Fox updated:

  • NanoTrasen finally began decorating for Christmas time, everyone's favourite commercial holiday. There were some delays due to the whole war and everything, but nothing will stop the Christmas cheer. Not even the mix-up from the fake-snow guy that's led to piles of Moghean sand filling the greenery areas. Whatever. Surely Unathi and people who usually celebrate the holiday during the Summer will be pleased.
  • Added some additional gift sprites by Happy_Fox

Geeves updated:

  • Fixed a maths error that caused flamethrower minimum fuel requirement to be too high.
  • Increased the size of flamethrowers, they no longer fit in your backpack.
  • Made lit flamethrowers work as flame sources, which means they can now light cigarettes.
  • Added more useful failure messages to make the operation of a flamethrower a bit easier.
  • You can now light a flamethrower without an igniter, by lighting it with an external flame source.
  • Legcuff sprites work again.
  • Legcuffing now works the same as handcuffing.
  • You can use cable restraints in-hand to turn them into weak legcuffs.
  • Sharp and edged weapons now sever tendons instead of breaking bones. Strong enough sharp and edged weapons sever tendons AND break bones.
  • Energy net projectors can now directly fire energy nets again.
  • Improved energy net code a little. It should be more reliable when firing at people.
  • Raised energy net health to 50, up from 25.
  • You can no longer damage an energy net with an empty hand while trapped inside it.
  • Damaging an energy net with a weapon while trapped inside it will do reduced damage.
  • Added some medical taperolls to the medical sub-level equipment area and EMT room. Also gave medical borgs medical taperolls.
  • Crumpled tape now stores who crumpled it, provided the crumpler had an ID to track them with.
  • Tape now physically blocks passage, unless the mover has their intent set to harm, or their move intent set to run.
  • Lifting tape now actually works as you'd expect it to. It plays a little animation and goes transparent. If you don't have access, it crumples, if you do, it doesn't. People can now pass over without crumpling it or needing intents set.

MoondancerPony updated:

  • Makes canisters use VueUI.
  • Makes labels on vui-item components optional.
  • Includes core-js for IE/ECMAscript compatibility shims..
  • Tweaks the numeric VueUI input to look more like the old NanoUI equivalent, with one plus/minus sign per power of 10 (+, ++, +++ for 1, 10, 100) instead of just identical buttons side-by-side.
  • Converts the chemical dispenser to use VueUI.
  • Adds a numeric input selector to the chemical dispenser.
  • You can now empty ashtrays into disposal units by clicking the disposal unit with the ashtray in hand. On harm intent, you will disposal the ashtray instead.
  • Tweaks messages when ashtrays are emptied out, hit, and used.
  • Ashtrays spill their contents when destroyed.
  • Using an ashtray in hand will dump its contents onto the ground.
  • Hitting an ashtray will now produce a sound and a visible message.
  • Fixes contagious UI styling due to an erroneous unscoped <style> tag.
  • Adds a check to ensure this never happens again.
  • Makes all VueUI view components use scoped styles. This shouldn't change anything except for fixing the aforementioned bug.

Wowzewow (Wezzy) updated:

  • Fixes chair overlays and coloring once and for all. Also, added more accurate previews which help in mapping and examining.
  • Added a new buckling sound for shuttle chairs.
  • Jackboots and any shoes which can hold knives now also show up on the mob icon. Keep your eyes peeled!
  • Refactors how shoes update their icons.
  • You can hit people with everything, even non-weapons. They won't do any damage, though...
  • Volume of hit sounds are now proportional to force applied. High damage, more loud.

16 December 2020

Chevy updated:

  • Added thirteen new cocktail recipes with unique sprites inspired by the lore. Now, you too can taste a Cloudy Oran or a Jovian Storm!
  • Changed the cuba libre recipe I changed a while back. It should now be simpler to make in large quantities.
  • New energy rifle sprites.

Geeves updated:

  • Fixed paper scanners causing text files to appear with unreadable black text.
  • The character preview directions are now aligned correctly.
  • Added a mounted foam sprayer to the mechfab hardsuit modules tab. It's a hardsuit module that consumes 1500 cell charge to spray a line of metal foam.
  • Added some effects to metal foam walls that make them a bit more flashy when destroyed, as well as adding a click cooldown so they can't be spammed down.
  • Aggressively slamming someone through a metal foam wall now does some damage to them.
  • Clicking on a metal foam wall with building materials will now attempt to turn it into a wall, taking a bit longer than a standard girder would. Clicking on it with a floor tile will now turn it into plating, if the space below is an open space or actual space.
  • Throwing a humanoid at another humanoid will knock both over.
  • Gave the Captain's uniform new sprites.
  • Viscerators can no longer be on the same tile as other viscerators.
  • Toxin now does damage to any egg clusters that a nurse spider injected into someone.
  • The amount of toxin bottles in medical vendors have been lowered to 1, down from 4.
  • Talking indicators now appear on the right, in order for them to not appear behind other HUD elements.
  • Thralls now get an icon next to their master to easier see and remember who they are. Likewise, vampires who have thralls now get little icons next to their thralls.

Geeves, Happy Fox updated:

  • Replaced ore radars with ore detectors. It display pings in the darkness when it spots the ore, even through walls.
  • Mining stationbounds and drones now get ore detectors.
  • You can now see psi-pings through walls again.

Wowzewow (Wezzy) updated:

  • Adds party poppers and confetti. Hooray!

15 December 2020

Ferner updated:

  • Fixed burglars starting with a less required number of enemies than intended.

Geeves updated:

  • Pulling things down stairs will maintain the pull.
  • Fixed the Old Earth Luxury Cognac lacking an empty sprite.

13 December 2020

Geeves updated:

  • Cargo Tugs and Janicarts now get a UI when you click on them.
  • Made interacting with the Pussywagon a bit nicer.
  • Emagging a cargo tug or janicart now makes it move faster.
  • Added an orderable pineapple pizza box, as well as a cheaper randomized pizza box.
  • Mining drones now come equipped with an RFD-M, a tethering device, and a stack of purple flags.
  • Mining drones can now bump against doors to open them.
  • Mining drones now have external airlock access.
  • You can now click-drag with the RFD-M to lay down track.
  • The charge cost for robots using the RFD-M has been lowered to 200, down from 500.
  • Mining drones no longer appear as a unique role on the round join menu.
  • Mining drone lights are now much brighter, and illuminate in a circle around the drone.
  • Flamethrowers can no longer fire with empty fuel tanks.
  • Flamethrowers now work with any flammable gas.

Wowzewow (Wezzy) updated:

  • Fixes beds spawning with the wrong materials.
  • Fixes chair materials.

12 December 2020

Geeves updated:

  • Added two xenofauna guns to the surface level checkpoint. They only do damage to carp, cavern dwellers, and spiders, inflicting pain on any other targets.

JohnWildkins updated:

  • Flamethrowers can now launch fire more than one tile away from the user.
  • The cone of the flamethrower has been narrowed somewhat, and its spread pattern somewhat randomized.
  • Flamethrowers now use a radial menu system rather than a basic HTML UI.

11 December 2020

Geeves updated:

  • Fixed first responder jacket sprites.

Sparky_Hotdog updated:

  • Added chopsticks, a new form of utensil. Available from the kitchen vendor now!
  • Rice Bowls now have the option to remove their chopsticks, and even put them back neatly when you're finished!

TheDocOct updated:

  • Adds five new variants of the Dominian cape, one for each Great House.

Wowzewow (Wezzy) updated:

  • Fixes detective badges not showing up in loadout. Bronze badges now have an onmob.

10 December 2020

Wowzewow (Wezzy) updated:

  • Adds a whole bunch of balloons, both seasonal and generic, as well as a whole bunch of features that they have.

09 December 2020

Geeves updated:

  • Changeling stings have been refactored. Now, you ready them when you click the ability. To use it, harm intent click your target with an empty hand. Clicking on the same sting ability will unprepare the sting.
  • Failing to speak into a radio will no longer just slap your message out loud, instead, you will still whisper, and the visible message for speaking will be 'tries speaking into the'.
  • Speaking on antagonist channels will no longer speak it out loud.
  • Replaced the fragile bottles of fertilizer with industrial jugs, sprites and sounds from Paradise.
  • The biogenerator can now print empty jugs.
  • You can no longer pour reagents from a container onto a tray or soil patch if the container's lid is on.
  • Catching on fire now shows a large message, being extinguished does as well.
  • Catching on fire will light any cigarettes on your person, being extinguished will likewise extinguish them.
  • Hitting rest will now make you lie down instantly.
  • Floating chat messages will now appear properly above resting humanoids.
  • Fixed maintenance-, mining-, and construction drones having weird lit up eyes. They should now update correctly.
  • Fixed the hat overlay of mining drones.
  • You can now punch people again.
  • Cult ghosts can no longer be clicked on or hovered over, thus they cannot block clicks.
  • Cancelling a vampire embrace by moving will no longer cause the target to instantly become a vampire.
  • You are no longer able to pull things when they fall down levels while you were pulling them.
  • Dead MALFs can no longer use their abilities.
  • Robots and AI no longer teleport things to themselves when ejecting them. (Like chem dispenser beakers).

JohnWildkins updated:

  • Vending machines spawned after mapload and/or by admins should no longer have missing icons.

Sparky_hotdog updated:

  • Removes the default medbot messages. Medbots start with speech off.
  • Adds the ability for robotisists or doctors to give medbots custom messages instead.

Wowzewow (Wezzy) updated:

  • Glass jars have been refactored.
  • Glass jars can now pick up animals held in hand.
  • Adds bronze badges for security officers.
  • Added detective badges to detective and forensic tech lockers, because they weren't there for some reason.

08 December 2020

JohnWildkins updated:

  • Repairing a robotic body part with a welding tool now fails (without damage) if it runs out of fuel before completion.
  • Nitroglycerin no longer explodes upon mixing, nor does it explode due to cold temperatures.
  • IPCs are no longer able to make their limbs human in character setup.
  • Stowing or equipping the RCD-T (malf fabricator) as a construction borg should no longer create an infinite inventory.
  • Using too low of a quality of scanning module in the camera upgrade process will now produce a warning.
  • Camera monitors should no longer trap players inside them if they lose power.
  • Writing in blood now checks for adjacency to the tile at each step of the writing process.
  • Rat skeletons (and other remains) now feel the effects of gravity, and should fall appropriately.
  • The unbitten half of a bitten chip is no longer able to infinitely produce nutrition via salsa or other dips.
  • Rods should no longer fail to superheat on a properly charged crossbow.
  • It is no longer possible to send hundreds of sheets of metal to the shadow realm by clicking on a girder repeatedly.
  • Meat kabobs can now be made using normal slabs of meat once again. Lasagna (2 flat dough, 2 meat, 2 tomato and 1 eggplant in the oven) and BLTs have had their recipes re-added as well.
  • Stasis bags should now degrade properly.
  • Committing suicide with a gun no longer summons bullets from hammerspace, nor does it completely break the gun.
  • Adjust Mask verb should now work properly.
  • Attempting to wet dry rags with sinks should no longer attempt to wipe down the sink (and thus the floor below it).

Karolis2011, JohnWildkins updated:

  • Replaced VueUI titlebar backend with a custom-built version by Karolis2011.
  • Users with the windows taskbar unhidden should no longer experience issues with dragging/selecting elements on VueUI windows.

07 December 2020

Geeves updated:

  • Pick-up animations now work.

06 December 2020

Bellumes, Ferner updated:

  • Added two new asteroid dungeon map templates, one mapped by Bellumes and one by Ferner.

Geeves updated:

  • Emergency Medical Technicians have been renamed to First Responders, their duties remain the same, for now.

JohnWildkins updated:

  • Mechatronic fabricators should now dispense synthskin and other non-industrial IPC limbs correctly.
  • Cryoing with the same mob name as another player should no longer remove both players from the manifest and records system.
  • Malf/traitor AI law deletion now correctly rebuilds the law list, so carding a malf AI no longer reveals extra laws (other than law zero).
  • Mobs that die while pointing no longer leave an infinite point marker.
  • Thermals, mesons, and material scanner overlays no longer function through security camera monitors.
  • Ported the titlebar replacement system from /tg/, adopted for Vue UIs. Vue-based UIs will now have their default BYOND titlebar replaced with a suitably themed equivalent, increasing available screen space and style.
  • Scrollbars now scroll only the content of a UI, and not the entire window - this should be most notable while using modular computer programs.
  • Developers can toggle the debug interface on and off in-game via the bug icon, even without UIDEBUG defined.

Sparky_Hotdog updated:

  • Goggles worn of your forehead no longer block people squirting stuff into your eyes with droppers

05 December 2020

Alberyk updated:

  • You can no longer hide large mobs inside closets.
  • You can no longer hide inside wallclosets.

Ferner updated:

  • Fixed airlock spawners not applying the correct cycle command to the buttons.
  • The csi kit now no longer goes invisible when carried in the hand on the other side of the player's sprite.

Geeves updated:

  • You can no longer ctrl-click to pull people out of grabs.
  • Pipe and wiring overlays generated by the t-ray scanner now click on the floor tile instead of the object directly, making it easier to crowbar.
  • T-ray scanner overlays are a little more transparent now.
  • Added Gun-Kata to the Martial Arts uplink for 4 TC. It allows the user to reload projectile weapons by clicking on magazines with the gun in-hand, as well as automatically ejecting magazines to the floor when they're empty.
  • Added a grenade that spawns lubed up viscerators. These viscerators coat the floor with lube when killed.

JohnWildkins updated:

  • Crates no longer pass through barricades or other objects that allow small objects (PASSTABLE) through.
  • Crates being lifted (and other timed interactions with objects) now stop being lifted if the crate is moved.

Wowzewow (Wezzy) updated:

  • Adds the ability to roll up newspaper to bat people in the head with.

04 December 2020

Wowzewow (Wezzy) updated:

  • Replaces DMItool with contemporary /tg/ version.

03 December 2020

Ferner updated:

  • Fixed colorable bandanas, softcaps and berets being darker than they're suppposed to be.

Geeves updated:

  • Removed the grilles in the penal colony, making it more difficult to escape.

JohnWildkins updated:

  • Non-NT/EPMC Liaisons should now once again spawn with an energy pistol and a camera.
  • Unanchoring and moving vending machines should now properly update their powered status.
  • Taping papers to lockers should no longer attempt to unlock/lock them.
  • Medbots and their assemblies should now apply toxin/fire/O2 medkit skins properly.
  • Polymorph wands should now correctly change the species of their targets.

Karolis2011 updated:

  • Computer clock now should show correct time.

Stryker updated:

  • Changed the water bottle flavor text to be more in line with lore.

Wowzewow (Wezzy) updated:

  • Glass jar mob size has been fixed.

02 December 2020

Alberyk updated:

  • Removed the component pouch from the loadout.

Geeves updated:

  • Using an item on a wall will no longer cause it to play the feeling around message. If you want to feel for an opening, use an empty hand.

MoondancerPony updated:

  • Fixes the date calculation for the Adhomian watch.

01 December 2020

Alberyk updated:

  • Removed the sleeping carp martial art from the uplink.

Geeves updated:

  • Lowered the cost of various uplink items across the board.
  • The sideeffect b-gone injector box on the uplink now spawns with four injectors.
  • Removed the AMR and its ammo from the uplink.
  • Optimized explosion code a little, it should be a teeny bit faster.
  • Added a full stop to the sentence saying which slot you're holding your animal / pAI / drone.
  • Species with off-centre alignments will now retain those alignments after attacking or after being grabbed.
  • You can now destroy the energy fields that shield generators make by hitting it, as long as your weapon is strong enough.
  • Energy shields now fade in and fade out, instead of just popping into existence.
  • Ported Pipe- and Floor Painter sprites from Paradise.

Karolis2011 updated:

  • Added back clock to modular computers.

MoondancerPony updated:

  • Gloves and mobs no longer keep a hardref to the mob whose blood they are covered in.

Wowzewow (Wezzy) updated:

  • Fixes pAIs unfolding out of glass jars.

26 November 2020

Ferner updated:

  • Added a light switch to the chapel.

Geeves updated:

  • Standard hyposprays can now choose to inject 5, 10, or 15 units per inject.
  • CMO hyposprays can now choose to inject 5, 10, 15, or 30 units per inject.
  • Standard syringes can now choose to inject 1, 2, 5, or 15 units per inject.
  • Revamped airlock construction messages, you will no longer keep hitting it like an orangutan if you do it out of sequence.
  • An airlock assembly's given finished name will now appear in brackets next to the assembly's name.
  • Airlock construction now uses three lengths of coil, instead of one.

Hocka updated:

  • Added medical gumballs - gumballs that spawn with tricordrazine.
  • Added a medical and normal variant of gumball jars. The medical gumball jar spawns on a table in the medical lobby every round and normal gumball jars can spawn in cargo.
  • Steel wool is now made from a steel sheet under the miscellaneous construction category. They are no longer made in autolathes.

Wowzewow (Wezzy) updated:

  • Fixes extinguisher refill inhands.
  • Striped shirts should now be named appropriately in the loadout.

25 November 2020

Alberyk updated:

  • Fixed corporate liaisons and consular officers spawning with the wrong radio.

Amunak updated:

  • The Setup-Supermatter debug verb should now work as expected - added markers that make it work. Also adds all coolant options in there.

Geeves updated:

  • Learner roles such as medical intern, security cadet, lab assistant, and engineering apprentice, now gets PDAs of their department's variant, instead of standard civilian.

Hocka updated:

  • Removes the chasm mask from the hydrogen tank viewport which was causing asteroid rocks to spawn in the window.

Kermit updated:

  • Thetamycin's metabolisation is now 3x as fast. It will take 5 minutes to begin to treat infections as opposed to 15 minutes.
  • Severe infections are once again treated when thetamycin ODs (20u) as opposed to at 30u (the former OD).

23 November 2020

DanseMacabre updated:

  • Made changeling morph a free ability that does not require a limb sacrifice. Also makes adrenaline sacs cheaper.

FieryTech updated:

  • Added a secure storage room for the science department, next to the conference room.
  • Added a science gun locker sprite, and script, for the new secure storage room.

Geeves updated:

  • The NanoMed Plus vendors now dispense four pill bottles each.
  • Viscerators no longer have funky blood overlays.
  • Healing animals now properly update their blood overlays.
  • AI holograms are now visible again.
  • AI can now set their holograms to be any humanoid within camera view.
  • Lattices, catwalks, and grates are now considered floors, which allows you to build certain structures such as railings, on top of them.
  • Doing CPR no longer displays any messages in the chat, instead it's visually telegraphed via images and animations.
  • Headsets no longer get put into the personal possessions box when spawning.

Hocka updated:

  • All roundstart phoron canisters were removed from the station. There are now three empty phoron canisters in engineering hard storage with one half-capacity canister. Toxins and the Anomaly lab have received a similar treatment.
  • The reserve phoron tank in atmos has had it's starting amount significantly reduced.
  • The four Nitrogen canisters in the engine room have been narrowed down to just 2 canisters and are now more clearly marked as emergency use.
  • Default empty canisters now start with their lights correctly displaying they are empty.

mikomyazaki updated:

  • Medical and Security autopsy rooms now have surgical drills for use on Vaurca.
  • Bodybags containing no living mobs can now be dragged significantly faster.

22 November 2020

Alberyk, mikomyazaki updated:

  • Added a Tajaran surgeon garb to the xeno loadout.

Amunak updated:

  • All clients will now be warned just before server restarts.

Geeves updated:

  • You can now attach signalers to canisters. When activated, the signaler will toggle the valve open or shut.
  • Attacking a canister now has a sound and an animation.
  • Updated the look of some gasses hanging in the air.
  • Turbo lifts now move much faster.
  • Loadout items that go on the ear slot now render correctly in the character creation menu.
  • Skrell loadout items that go in the ear slot included.
  • pAI radios no longer let people two tiles away hear them, now you need to be on top of them to hear, or vice versa. The range can be configured in the radio configuration app.
  • Actually gave pAI access to common and entertainment, the standard for user radios.

Wowzewow (Wezzy) updated:

  • Scrubs all references to Vox and Vox Armalis from the code.
  • You can now choose whether you have a regular headset or bowman headset equipped in the loadout.

mikomyazaki updated:

  • Improved multi-mode antagonist selection logic.

21 November 2020

Ferner updated:

  • The security maintenance exterior airlock now has an outward facing access button.
  • Fixed premade combat mechs spawning without weapons.

Geeves updated:

  • Fake death lings should now be slightly harder to detect by medical.
  • Engineering apprentice, lab assistant, and medical intern slots have been increased by one, for a total of 3.

MattAtlas updated:

  • Removes the toxin hivebot beacon as it is too powerful.

greenjoe12345 updated:

  • Adds a new eyepatch to the loadout and fixes the current eyepatch sprite covering both eyes

mikomyazaki updated:

  • Fixed some xenoarcheology artifacts that would spawn mobs within objects, rather than on turfs as required.
  • Burglar gamemode only requires one antagonist to start.

20 November 2020

mikomyazaki updated:

  • Using a welder on a broken airlock twice rapidly will no longer allow you to cut the cover for the bolts and the bolts simultaneously.
  • Charging cable beams will now appear properly when you initially connect them.

19 November 2020

Aboshehab updated:

  • Added missing regulations from the wiki to processing console.
  • Update and adjust descriptions, names, credit fines and time to match the wiki for the processing console.

Doxxmedearly updated:

  • Adjusted bounties and warehouse spawns regarding phoron to reflect lore developments.

Geeves updated:

  • Clicking on a folded up pAI with an encryption key now slots the key into the pAI card, granting it access to those radio channels.
  • You can remove pAI encryption keys by using a screwdriver on them.
  • Added some holopads to useful locations.

Hocka updated:

  • The engine cooling radiator's motion sensor has been replaced with a normal security camera.
  • ChemMasters now dispense pill bottles and beakers to the hand directly.
  • There are now two Hydrogen canisters in the atmos sub-level.
  • A light has been added to the window viewport for the hydrogen reserve tank.
  • Hydrogen canister names are now spaced correctly.

MoondancerPony updated:

  • Smartfridges now place items in your hand if possible.

Stryker, Kyres, NiennaB updated:

  • Adds a Martian hoodie to the loadout under suits and accessories.
  • Adds a Tau Ceti armband to the armband selection.
  • Adds a Golden Deep dress, wrap, and vest done by Kyres as well as suit and skirtsuit by NiennaB to Xenowear - IPC. (FTs by IPC team.)
  • Changes Golden Deep arm and headchain accessories to match the color palette of the clothes.

mikomyazaki updated:

  • Gamemodes will no longer fail to start with enough antagonists due to a mismatch between expected enemies and actual required enemies due to the antagonist role types.
  • Siege (Rev+Merc) now requires 25 minimum players (10 antagonists) instead of 20.
  • Uprising (Rev+Traitor) now requires 20 minimum players (7 antagonists) instead of 15.
  • Pressure Regulators in INPUT regulation mode will now be able to transfer gas when the output is a vacuum.
  • Chameleon caps will have an icon again.
  • Being crushed by an airlock while inside something (e.g. a locker) will no longer teleport you outside of the thing.

18 November 2020

Ferner updated:

  • Odin medical specialists and pharmacists now spawn with medhuds instead of sunglasses.

JohnWildkins updated:

  • Fixed full-auto weapons not suffering the one-hand penalty appropriately.

Wowzewow (Wezzy) updated:

  • Fixes the shading of the jumper skirt.
  • Face direction verb now behaves like the pre-vision cone version.

mikomyazaki updated:

  • Can now whisper while restrained.

17 November 2020

Alberyk, Coalf, Sleepywolf updated:

  • Added Tajara themed title screens.

Ferner updated:

  • Lowered the max number of players for the burglar gamemode from 20 to 15.

Geeves updated:

  • .click, .dblclick, and .mouse macros have been disabled.
  • Pick-up macros have been disabled.
  • Added a replacement verb for clicking your mov_intent. Simply make a macro with 'mov_intent' as the command.
  • Added replacement verbs for clicking on your uniform, belt, and backpack. These macros are 'click_uniform', 'click_belt' and 'click_back' respectively.
  • The bodyscanner console now reports in which external they are, such as 'Chest' or 'Groin'.
  • The bodyscanner now reports parasites growing within the body.
  • The bodyscanner now periodically updates its UI.
  • The zombie parasite now grows inside the head, instead of the chest.
  • Zombies can no longer pick up items. If they somehow pick up a gun, they can no longer fire it.
  • Zombies can no longer operate radios.
  • Zombies have gained their own martial art. Three attacks in a row will provide an armor piercing bite, whilst their grabs automatically put someone into an aggressive grab.
  • Zombies now take half brute and burn damage. Additionally, they move and sprint slower now.
  • Zombies can now slip. Oh boy.
  • Zombie bites can now only take trioxin levels up to 30u, where it plateaus.
  • Zombies now regenerate broken bones, severed tendons and arteries. If they regenerate broken bones, their brute wounds will heal to prevent rebreaks. Each heal will cause the next heal to take two seconds longer, starting from 5 seconds. Only the head is exempt from this healing.
  • You no longer automatically scream, if you cannot feel pain.
  • Collapsing no longer gives you a blindness overlay.
  • Collapsing from stance damage such as broken or missing leg and feet now only happens once every 8 to 16 seconds.
  • Using a remote control mech now transfers your ID card access to it.
  • It is now possible to know more than one martial art at the same time, while reaping the benefits of all of them.
  • Only the unarmed attacks of your primary martial art will be executed, if you have more than one art, the option to choose will appear in the abilities tab.
  • Created a new Martial Arts uplink category, added Sleeping Carp, 12 TC, and Swordsmanship, 5 TC, to it.
  • Martial Art projectile deflection has been reflavoured to make it dodging, for the sake of believability. Ha ha ha.
  • Sleeping carp now properly only instantly kills someone who's in crit.
  • The Recall Teachings ability is now put into the abilities tab instead of a unique tab for the martial arts.
  • Full power vamps can now pull people they're grabbing into their veil walk.
  • Re-added the right click pick up verb.

Hocka, Furrycactus updated:

  • Added Hydrogen gas, canisters, tanks and a new atmos tank to contain Hydrogen. Hydrogen can be used as a slightly less effective alternative gas for Phoron in the Supermatter. Or for making fires.
  • Removed the four nitrogen canisters in Engineering Hard Storage with four hydrogen canisters. Removes two phoron canisters in toxins with Hydrogen canisters.

JohnWildkins updated:

  • Dionae are selectable in character select once more.
  • Chat-input emotes should now function again.

Wowzewow (Wezzy) updated:

  • Water tanks now transfer its max volume by default. This is mainly for backpack water tanks.

16 November 2020

Amunak updated:

  • Changing someone's rank will no longer cause a runtime that causes Crew Manifest to stop working / show nothing.

Geeves updated:

  • The species select in the character creation menu will now display the main species first, and then the sub-species after select the main one, instead of putting them all in one screen.

Hocka updated:

  • The engine radiator airlocks no only require one of the listed accesses instead of all of them. The radiator shutter button has also received the same treatment.

Wowzewow (Wezzy) updated:

  • All small mobs fit in the glass jar now.

15 November 2020

Alberyk updated:

  • Disabled Sol Alliance consular officers due to Lore reasons.
  • Fixed species transformation causing species to get accents that they should not be able to select.

Amunak updated:

  • Fixes APC UI initial height so that scrolling is not necessary.
  • Admins can now operate APCs (when ghosted).
  • Admins can now operate airlocks with special privileges ONLY when ghosted (to prevent accidental admin abuse).
  • Airlock VueUI should now properly update constantly (including admin options).

Hocka updated:

  • Emitter shot counter display text and signaller display text is now adjusted to the user's font size.

mikomyazaki updated:

  • Maintenance drones no longer have chat clients installed by default.

14 November 2020

Amunak updated:

  • Aligned Crew Manifest columns. The window had to be embiggened a bit to make this look decent.
  • Fixed VueUI not refreshing (or closing or working properly) when re-opened after being closed.

Geeves updated:

  • Added six pack yokes for energy drinks, a storage item for moving a fast amount of energy drinks quickly. Currently adminspawn only.
  • Radiojammers now also block wireless access to various objects stationbounds (AIs, Cyborgs) can access, such as doors, firedoors, and so forth. Being adjacent to the object will negate this.
  • Non-improvised radiojammers can now be configured to only block stationbound signals. When set to all, it stops everything it did before, as well as stationbounds.
  • Simple animals such as rats that don't have universal speak or a language can no longer be translated by holopads.
  • Fixed a verb that caused visible messages (and more) to break.
  • Added a small outpost to the engine radiator area.
  • Gave mining and xenoarch access to the engine radiator airlocks, because they keep getting stuck there. Which is hilarious.
  • Wizard golems are now given an antag role, which grants them access to AOOC.

JohnWildkins updated:

  • Fixed the Custodial Supplies Locator app not functioning.
  • PDAs should no longer display multiple messages when disconnecting their charging cables. They also have a gentler message for purposeful disconnecting and play a sound when connecting a cable.
  • Excessive runtimes should no longer occur from badly-formed beams.

MattAtlas updated:

  • Fixes a bunch of runtime errors.

13 November 2020

Amunak updated:

  • Added a new 'announcer' mob and used it instead of AI for 'autosay' as an optimization.

12 November 2020

Amunak updated:

  • Latejoin menu is now VueUI and more similar to crew manifest - it is divided to sections and uses crew manifest colors. It shows a preview of your character. It no longer distinguishes active but AFK players.
  • Crew Manifest now uses VueUI (the exact same one as the modular computers program). This means that crew manifest will no longer indicate AFK players as inactive for ghosts and lobby sitters.
  • Crew Manifest program can now print the manifest with a button in the UI.
  • The ID modification program no longer shows the crew manifest or is able to print it.
  • Crew Manifest, Latejoin menu and occupation selection in character creation have been made prettier and more readable with a common color palette for departments.
  • All departmental jobs now have a department assigned (intern jobs and forensic technician). This slightly changed the antagonist report generated, but now it's especially needed for the latejoin menu sorting to work.
  • Leaving the round now actually decreases the job count for a given job, freeing up the slot for others. This also fixes wrong people counters in latejoin menu. As a result AIs now use different logic to check if they can spawn/latejoin and their numbers are also correct.
  • Added SCSS style utilities inspired by Bootstrap for easier UI styling with the use of just classes.
  • Department names are now defines, crew manifest logic has been simplified to accommodate this. The 'Heads' section is now called 'Command'.
  • Jobs now store departments as a list so Command is no longer magic. Flags can be assigned to each department (like 'this is a supervisor/head of this department).'
  • Moved Vue departmental colors into a separate Sass file, making it available to all either as a universal map or as predefined classes for text color (.text-dept-medical) and background (.bg-dept-medical).

Geeves updated:

  • Fixed various holopad bugs, like icon states being wrong.
  • Added an examine to holopads to see which pad it's connected with.
  • Added a visible message to interacting with a holopad, so people around you can see that you're doing so.
  • Added a new sprite for holopads that are pending a call pick-up.
  • Fixed holopads (and other things) not being able to pick up emotes.

JohnWildkins updated:

  • Drop hotkey (Q) should now properly work to drop things held by robotic grippers.

Wowzewow (Wezzy) updated:

  • Show held item now shows an icon beside the item.

mikomyazaki updated:

  • Borg Hyposprays now act like normal hyposprays, can inject people in spacesuits and are non-instantaneous.

11 November 2020

Alberyk updated:

  • Fountain pens start with the cursive option off by default now.

Amunak updated:

  • Maintenance drones can be disposaled again properly.

Ferner, Valwyn updated:

  • Added a black, unstriped fedora to the loadout. Spritework by Valwyn.

Geeves updated:

  • People who latejoin can now be turned into antags as well, provided they have the role preference selected, it's a station antag, and amount of antags is lower than or equal to the living player count divided by the antag count coeff.
  • Breaking cuffs is now per species, instead of per species per sex. This means that female unathi can break cuffs now.
  • The visitor ghostrole no longer appears as a unique role on the join menu.
  • Added a new room to maintenance.

mikomyazaki updated:

  • Robots no longer have hud items in their inventory.
  • Robots that have an active sensor augmentation (security or medical) will now be able to change details of examine targets, as if they had a physical hud item in their hand.
  • Vision cones have been removed. Thank you to everyone that provided feedback while we tried out this feature!
  • The drop hotkey (default Q) will now drop things held by robot grippers.
  • The Access Transmission device now works on maintenance drones, too.

10 November 2020

Amunak updated:

  • Slightly improves varedit by adding the variable type to the display.

Chevy updated:

  • Added a new cocktail and associated sprite, the Rum and Cola. Uses the existing Cuba Libre recipe of 2 parts rum and 1 part space cola.
  • Added a new recipe for the Cuba Libre. Mix 5 parts Rum and Cola with 1 part lime juice.
  • Cuba Libre is now worth .01 more when you ship it via cargo to reflect the fact that you have to make it out of another cocktail now.

Geeves updated:

  • Mortaphenyl and oxycomorphine now metabolize three times faster.
  • Alkysine can now be used to counteract confused moving chem side effects, while oculine can be used to counteract eyeblur chem side effects.
  • Synaptizine no longer wildly damages all organs, instead having a chance each time it metabolizes to damage the liver, which is fine, unless the liver has been damaged already, or is taking damage from multiple sources.
  • Fixed the maintenance drone ghost spawner.
  • Added more info as to why certain ghost spawners are disabled to the ghost spawner menu.

Geeves, Happy Fox updated:

  • Vampires with victim awareness enabled will no longer drop their victims to the floor.
  • Stunned people can no longer interact with radios. This means that you cannot use a radio while being bloodsucked.
  • Clicking the drain blood ability whilst draining blood will now cause you to stop sucking blood at the end of the next drain cycle.
  • Gaining a vampire power is now displayed a bit nicer in the chat log.
  • Vampires now have a UI element on the HUD for how much usable blood they have, what their frenzy counter is at, and to suck people.
  • Removing vampire status from a player now removes their vampire abilities and such.
  • Vampires now can only suck up until 950 units of usable blood.
  • Vampire glare now stuns IPCs and cyborgs as well.
  • Hulks no longer have funky punctuation.
  • Veil walking now uses your mob sprite instead of a generic ghost sprite.
  • Triggering veil walking now breaks all grabs on you.
  • The vampire help menu has been revamped to be more up to date and stylish.

JohnWildkins updated:

  • Handheld modular computers now use flashlights as a light source. They may be turned on/off via a button in the PC header, and have their brightness adjusted in Hardware Configuration.
  • Chat messages are now logged to the NTNet Monitoring program.
  • PDA mesasge notifications should now appear much larger.
  • IDs are now unregistered from computers when the computer is destroyed.
  • Fix Eject Battery having a global view range.
  • Chat Clients are no longer set to 'silent' by default.
  • Added a new slider component for VueUIs.

Wowzewow (Wezzy) updated:

  • CCIA and FIB agents have cool new ID badges.

mikomyazaki updated:

  • Fixes issue where antag types with ANTAG_OVERRIDE_JOB was selecting zero players despite players signing up for the role.

09 November 2020

Amunak updated:

  • Buckets and sinks now transfer maximum amount per use. Water tanks transfer 100 by default, extinguisher, lube and fuel tank 30.
  • Sinks and water/extinguisher/etc tanks now also have new info description reminding people that they can change the amount transferred.

Ferner updated:

  • Fixed the tcfl field beret being invisible.

mikomyazaki updated:

  • Research Module Borgs' Access Code Transmission Device will now properly lock/unlock robots.
  • Fixed an issue where multi-modes (e.g. Uprising (Rev+Traitor)) would consider players multiple times to see if we had enough enemies, although the player could not play multiple roles simultaneously. Therefore multi-rounds could be considered valid modes when they were not, and rounds would start with too few players in one or more roles.

07 November 2020

Amunak updated:

  • Refactors worst offenders from the unsorted.dm helpers file to where they fit better (atoms.dm, mobs.dm, ...).
  • Fixes messages for water tank wrenching/unwrenching - they were flipped and gramatically dubious.
  • Changed how cargo spawning defines (STOCK_ITEM_*) work in order to fix an issue with deep recursion and prevent a runtime from it.

Flpfs updated:

  • Rescue borgs now have a medical gripper instead of a magnetic one.

Geeves updated:

  • Changing between mobs no longer changes your hotkey toggle status.
  • Sending psionic messages now properly puts a full stop at end.

Hocka updated:

  • Noticeboards now try to put paper directly into your hands instead of immediately on the floor.

mikomyazaki updated:

  • Security Belts can now contain disruptor pistols of all kinds.

05 November 2020

Amunak updated:

  • Fixes runtimes on HUD creation related to players joining before SSAtoms starts working.
  • Fixes runtime for Runtime (the map) which has no shuttles mapped.

Flpfs updated:

  • Ports collapsible wheelchairs from Polaris.
  • Wheelchairs are now available in a color-customizable form via the loadout, under utility.

Geeves updated:

  • Holopads should work now again.

mikomyazaki updated:

  • The 'Debug Mob Lists' verb can now list mobs that have gone to cryo this round.

04 November 2020

Chevy updated:

  • Swapped the buttoned and unbuttoned obj sprites for the designer red leather jacket so that it would use the buttoned sprite while buttoned and the unbuttoned sprite while unbuttoned.
  • Replaced the Dominian Noble Coat 5 buttoned sprite with an actual buttoned sprite instead of it just using the unbuttoned sprite for both. This is probably useless because I don't think it's used for anything, but I saw it while I was fixing the other thing and fixed this too.

Geeves updated:

  • Holocalls now send holograms of people in the vicinity to whichever pad it's connected to, instead of just sending the caller's hologram. You no longer have to stand on the holopad to talk. Give it a try.

Hocka, Happy_Fox updated:

  • Added steel wool which can be ignited with a cell/other flame source to briefly light up an area, as well as light other things. Can be obtained via autolathe.
  • Empty cans can now be turned into jury-rigged shrapnel grenades which are made by filling cans with welding fuel, adding a fuse with steel wool and lighting it using a flame source. Shorter fuses have a chance to instantly detonate and longer fuses can fizzle out prematurely. Large grenade casings can be used to increase the amount of shrapnel.

Wowzewow (Wezzy) updated:

  • Adds the missing janitor softcaps and bandanas to the loadout.
  • Modifies and adds appropriate departmental berets.
  • Corporate berets have been tweaked to match their respective uniforms more closely.
  • Inhand items using contained sprites should follow colorations properly now.
  • Larger golems can no longer wear uniforms.

03 November 2020

Chada updated:

  • Added a mobility tool to the Rescue module, it acts as a speedboost on par with a VTEC.
  • Altered the Rescue and Medical modules hyposprays to reflect the current medical better.
  • Fixed an oversight that made the Mining drones drill not available on round start.
  • Fixed all of the Cyborg/Drone jetpacks being broken.

Greenjoe12345 updated:

  • Adds a white cane. Adds this white cane and the already exsisting crutch item to the loadout.

JohnWildkins updated:

  • Fixes players entering cryo or PDAs that were destroyed not being removed from available messengers.
  • Some subspecies (Zeng-hu IPC, Tajara subspecies) should now move at their intended speeds.

NiennaB, Stryker updated:

  • Changed the Unbranded IPC and prosthetics sprites with one by NiennaB.

mikomyazaki updated:

  • Charging cables, such as those on PDAs, will now connect properly to the APC icon rather than the turf infront of it.
  • Beams, such as charging cables, will no longer exist for one tick then delete themselves when being engaged from beyond max range.
  • You can no longer climb over a railing if the way is blocked on the other side (e.g. by a window).

02 November 2020

Flpfs updated:

  • Tajara and Unathi can now be doctors and pharmacists at the Odin.
  • IPCs can now be civil protection, doctors, pharmacists, bartenders, cooks and janitors at the Odin.
  • Added maglites to the SecTech vendors.

Geeves, Dronz updated:

  • Added new clothes for unathi, wasteland kilts, straw hats, wasteland goggles, standalone hoods.
  • Roughspun robes are now recolourable. Mogazali attire is no longer recolourable.
  • Added footwraps and caligae to the xeno clothes closet.

Wowzewow (Wezzy) updated:

  • Fixes Coalition and Sol voidsuits not accepting oxygen tanks.
  • Fixes invisible bandanas.
  • Adds spam limiters to coinflips, toy swords and ID cards.

01 November 2020

Alberyk updated:

  • Cyanide pills are no longer named cyanide pills.

Amunak updated:

  • Varedit now remembers what was in the 'search' field when you click the 'refresh' link.
  • Tweaked varedit styles ever so slightly: it will now likely use a more preferred monospace font. Keys are bold and also monospace.
  • 'NOFALL' is now a status flag instead of being a var specific to BSTechs. It allows the mob to move between Z-levels and through empty space; even to 'fly up' against gravity. However the tech can no longer use this to 'phase into' matter if there is something above them.
  • For that you want to use Ruin-Everything instead: incorporeal movement now has an additional type that's just like a ninja's, but it also allows you to move between Z-levels.
  • Adds the anti-gravity verb to the Bluespace Robot preset and starts them with 'NOFALL' on.
  • When using 'GODMODE' you will no longer take damage when you fall; instead a cool message will be shown and a quiet thump will be played.
  • 'GODMODE' now protects you from the awful effects of running - you can run indefinitely and won't take damage from it.
  • BSTechs now have additional vision mode - 'darkvision' for seeing normally but without lighting.
  • Some of the more arcane BSTech verbs have been renamed and descriptions improved (with some added flavour). Rejuv -> Restore Health. Toggle-Gravity -> Toggle-Falling (we now have actual gravity on the station, so let's not confuse people). And finally Ruin-Everything -> Toggle Incorporeal Movement - as lovely as the name is, it doesn't make much sense. This isn't Kill-Everyone or whatever.
  • Thanks to the above changes the BST is now self-contained in a single file (well except for the robot preset).
  • To facilitate the above changes several godmode and incorporeal checks have been added (mostly to movement procs). It cuts on some extra proc overrides and type checks. Also results in a more 'natural' experience when using NOFALL, GODMODE or incorporeal movement.
  • Changed incorporeal values to defines.
  • Admins can now override a Respawn verb failure for themselves without calling Allow-Player-To-Respawn first.

Ferner updated:

  • The bridge research shuttle control console will now work again.

Geeves updated:

  • Added a GPS to the janitorial closets.
  • Janitor belts now hold 8 items instead of 6.
  • Mapped in some basic materials for janitors. These materials are for simple window and table repairs, as per the janitor wiki page.
  • Emagging the pest gun now increases its shot capacity to 10.
  • An emagged pest gun now does 15 burn damage per shot, as well as 30 halloss damage. Changed from only doing 60 halloss.
  • The wall fungi event now gives GPS coordinates to the place it's growing.
  • Wall fungi can now be scraped off by any sharp object, and then grinded to access some useful reagents within.

JohnWildkins updated:

  • Added modular computer versions of PDAs. Programs that were only available on PDA were ported where possible/necessary.
  • Added ability to select type of PDA (tablet, wristbound, PDA, or none) in character select.
  • Added charging cables for recharging handheld modular computers. Simply use a handheld computer on an APC to begin charging. Also added hotswappable batteries, which may be removed and slotted-in without tools.
  • Card slots on modular computers can now store items, just as PDAs once did.
  • Power capacity of modular computer batteries increased across the board. Standard PDAs should last approximately two-hours (server time).
  • NTIRC (messenger) now requires a registered ID to be used. NTIRC is set to autorun and will attempt to start itself at roundstart, as well as automatically register you.
  • pAI Atmosphere Sensor and pAI Signaller are now open-use programs. Handheld PDAs are now universally private devices.
  • Using an ID on a computer with an occupied card slot will now swap the cards, where possible.
  • Removed PDAs, cartridges, and all functionality relating to them.
  • An event failing to spawn should no longer hell-spawn fifteen copies of another event.

Wowzewow (Wezzy) updated:

  • Added five new sets of PDA-style sprites, complete with transparency / modular program support.

31 October 2020

Amunak updated:

  • Starting message when joining as an AI has been moved to a separate pop-up window and expanded. It is now also available as a verb 'AI-Help'. This prevents message spam when they start while providing more information to new players. It also contains OOC info noting that players should be mindful of not ruining fun for others.
  • Airlocks hacking UI now shows pretty colors for the values. Also tweaked some messages and display of the UI. Most importantly, when power is off the message is now simplified to 'all the lights are off'.
  • Whether AIs can or cannot bolt airlocks is now determined by new states of the 'AI control' wire. It is no longer just 'off' (or cut or emagged) and 'on'. It can be 'off' (cut), 'red' (emagged), 'orange' (AI can control doors but not bolt them) or 'green' (AI can bolt or unbolt the doors). Pulsing the control wire toggles between green and orange, cutting and emagging still works the same. Some airlocks are 'locked' (can be mapped or changed by subtype; currently high security doors do this) and pulsing the control wire does nothing.
  • The 'AI control' state of most airlocks defaults to whether the airlock is locked (mappers and airlock subtypes can override this). This means that most airlocks are by default 'orange', so AIs cannot drop (or raise!) bolts on the vast majority of airlocks. The exception are secure airlocks, hatches (like on tcommsat) and external airlocks whose bolts can be controlled by the AI (in case of external airlocks most are bolted anyway, so AI would have bolt control regardless).
  • There is now an announcement and a delay of 8 seconds for raising and 4 seconds for dropping the bolts by AIs (traitor AIs are not affected by this, though they can choose to 'fake' it). High security doors have even higher delays (10/5) and vault has the highest (12/8). It is also no longer possible to spam the message - only one action can be done at a time and AIs must wait for it to complete.
  • Tweaked some AI airlock action messages to facilitate the above changes. Additionally the bolt announcement message is now an audible instead of visual.
  • AIs, when using 'Radio Settings', now see their radio channel keys. They are also displayed in 'AI-Help'.
  • Door now properly updates icon when it regains power.
  • Moved code that gathers radio channels for AI to a separate proc.
  • Fixes admin check in airlock VueUI. Also allows admins to actually toggle stuff like bolts, safeties and electrification. De-admin yourself if you want to actually play!
  • Refactored some of the airlock code, especially stuff regarding displaying messages and toggling bolts. Some of it was necessary for these changes, other parts I think I just made more readable.

Ferner updated:

  • The research shuttle can now also be docked at yellow dock.

Flpfs updated:

  • Service cyborgs can now pick up clams and molluscs.

Geeves updated:

  • Projectiles hitting mobs will now not display an admin log if both the firer and the target has no client connected.
  • Autohissssss has been added to the character creation menu, and will now perssssisssst roundssss and logoutssss.
  • Diona now absorb knowledge along with language when sucking blood, this is a user prompt that the suckee must enter, and will probably fail to.
  • Diona gestalts can now also sample DNA to learn languages and gain knowledge.
  • Diona now inject a medium painkiller when sucking blood, called 'Aphrodite'.

Hocka updated:

  • Airlocks now display messages when crushing people.

JohnWildkins updated:

  • Vending machines now have a graphical, icon-based item interface based in VueUI.
  • Vending machines now have a search bar.
  • Icon lag when using vending machines should no longer exist.
  • Updated the Aut'akh religion lore blurb.

Naelynn updated:

  • Allows Vaurca to select generic augment loadout items.

mikomyazaki updated:

  • Antagonists hiding inside something (locker, chameleon projection, etc.) at round end will now appear properly in the end-of-round antag display text.

30 October 2020

Amunak updated:

  • Fixes hardcoded health checks setting to 100 instead of maxHealth (mainly in godmode checks but also pAI).
  • Added low level APCs (with just a regular battery), to be used in offices and other smaller, less critical areas. This allows long-term power loss to be of some consequence. Mapped into the security areas.
  • Split upper security (investigations & training) into multiple per-room areas as it should be. Added light switches and APCs for those areas.
  • The room with stairs to Training is now a part of the Training area, not Brig.
  • Evidence Storage is now its own area as well.
  • From security/brig there were two rooms split: the 'control room' and 'processing'. Also added APCs.
  • Added back the option to toggle lights to most Security areas (basically everything but places where prisoners are held).
  • Added/modified area icons for most of the areas mentioned above for easier mapping.
  • It is no longer possible to recycle any random crap in the Autolathe. It is now limited to 'reasonable' items such as stack materials, shards, tiles, reagent containers, power cells, shields and a handful of other things. Complex devices, guns, stuff that clearly wouldn't fit or doesn't make much sense to recycle (returns almost no useful materials) is no longer possible to recycle.
  • It should be no longer possible to 'cheat' in the Autolathe by inserting items that give more materials than they cost to make in the Protolathe.
  • Fixed a handful of the remaining problematic autolathe recipes / recyclation materials to not cost less than they're worth.
  • Fixed stack material recipes to not create more product matter than they consume: metal rods and all floor tiles are now worth about half of their previous materials.
  • Fixes minor instatiation issues with hand teleporter and an organ when initialized in a non-typical way.
  • Moved the list of research designs to global level. This allows only single initialization of it.
  • Added unit test to check if material costs of all research designs are greater than what can be gained from recycling their products.
  • Added unit test to check if material costs of stack recipes are greater than what can be gained from recycling their products.
  • Borers and other flips of the PASSEMOTES flag will no longer change the CANWEAKEN flag.

Geeves updated:

  • Headsets' object sprites have been changed to fit their departmental colours.
  • Added blood overlays to simple mobs.
  • Dead antagonists now get their last words displayed at round end.
  • Small animals and nymphs can no longer wriggle out of bags or your hand when below 60% HP.

JohnWildkins updated:

  • Rescue Pod and Visitor ghost spawners are now mid-round events, rather than a 10% chance to activate on round start.
  • Added a new subtype of Rescue Pod, which sends a single burglar to the Aurora on non-extended rounds.
  • Decreased chances of Moderate Infestations, Carp Schools, and Rogue Drone events. Increased chances of Radiation Storm, Electrical Storm, and Communication Blackout events.
  • Changed Appendicitis chance to scale off slotted Surgeons, rather than medical staff. Rampant Brand Intelligence now scales off of engineers rather than janitors.
  • Removed powergrid check event from rotation, boosted Electrical Storm chance to compensate.

The Stryker, NiennaB updated:

  • Added circle and horn antennas to the loadout (Xenowear - IPC, antenna selection).
  • Added ripped jeans under the pants selection in the loadout, as well as a colorable jumpsuit in the uniforms tab.
  • Added a Himeo engineering and atmos voidsuit that can be made with the Himeo voidsuit kit and an existing engineering/atmos voidsuit.
  • The Himeo suit sprite no longer has side views when dragged.
  • IPC antennae sprites have been changed to be smaller.

Wowzewow (Wezzy) updated:

  • EPMC cap should be now lore appropriate colored.

mikomyazaki updated:

  • Power cells now drain to exactly zero when it fails to completely satisfy a power demand. This will solve cases where the game thought cells with an extremely small amount of power weren't empty. e.g. Out of power robots that could not move not being able to use their Power Warning verb.

28 October 2020

Amunak updated:

  • Admins now have a new secret to turn all light switches on, off or to their initial state.
  • The 'area/set_lightswitch' proc can now be passed 'null' to set the area lights to initial state.

Geeves updated:

  • Examining trolleys and engines will now tell you whether they're being towed, or towing something, and what exactly those are.
  • Mapped in various airlocks with one-way exits, meaning that you don't need access to exit if you come from that direction. This is primarily to let people out of departments without escorts.
  • Added the option to put one-way exits in airlocks via airlock electronics.
  • Creating stacks from material recipes will now update their icons to display their true fullness, such as making rods out of steel.
  • Emitters now track how many shots they've fired, which gets reset when they get activated. Examine them while adjacent to them to read the value.
  • Science can now print cargo trolley circuitboards, built with 15 power coils and 1 capacitor.
  • Lobbysitter HUDs now properly update the Ready/Join button when the round starts.
  • Part replacers now output the contents of closed machines nicely.
  • Added dual wielding. Firing a gun while another is in the off-hand will fire that one as well, at the cost of lost accuracy. You must be on harm intent to do this.

Hocka updated:

  • Simple mobs revived by lazarus injectors now show their alive description text.

Naelynn updated:

  • Added Uranium Solidification chemmical reaction. Mix 20 units of liquid uranium, 5 units of frost oil and 5 units of potassium to create a sheet of uranium.

27 October 2020

Alberyk updated:

  • Spontaneous appendicitis should be rarer now.

Ferner updated:

  • Removed some unused scarfs in code.
  • Put winterboots in the loadout under boots, removed duplicate cowboy boots selection as these were already present under boot selection.

MattAtlas updated:

  • If there are new polls, the poll button will now be highlighted.
  • You can no longer open the crew manifest before the game starts.

NewOriginalSchwann updated:

  • Changes Deep Frontier (DFR) to Non-Coalition Frontier (NCF).

26 October 2020

Amunak updated:

  • All opacity changes (like when you toggle tinted windows) should now trigger camera visibility update (so that the AI can't spy through tinted windows until something else triggers the update).
  • Camera in Consular Office and Representative's Office has been removed for their privacy. Instead the Diplomatic Reception has additional camera so that the AI can still see inside both rooms as long as the window tint is off. Even with the tint on with open doors the AI can see at least the chairs of the representatives.
  • Added missing bolt buttons for toilettes: engineering, command, patient.
  • Replaced regular bed in ICU with a roller bed.
  • Added a bucket to medical custodial storage.

Geeves updated:

  • Fixes a sprite issue where vaurca warrior's left feet were one pixel too far to the left, causing their feet to appear outside their shoes.
  • Lights, air alarms, and APCs can now be placed in areas that don't necessarily require power.
  • Industrial Smelters can be upgraded with the part replacer again.
  • Unlatched trolleys can now be hitched again by dragging from the trolley you want to hitch to, to the unhitched trolley.
  • Fixes the gas names on air alarms.
  • Floodlights can now be rotated with alt-click.
  • Grilles no longer play an attack message after being unscrewed.
  • Added and mapped in a Slime Extractor to the Xenobio level, which extract all the cores within a slime, it will deposit them into a slime core bag if one is next to it. It can be upgraded.
  • Added the above's machine circuit to circuit imprinters.

JohnWildkins updated:

  • Items can no longer be placed through closed windoors, nor can mobs be attacked past them.
  • Windoors are now affected by power loss; non-secure (brig) windoors no longer check for access, but must be pushed open. Brig windoors lock shut and cannot be moved without power.

MattAtlas updated:

  • Fixes some emotes such as pain dropping items not working.

Snakebittenn updated:

  • Adds some fishnet underwear options.

Yonnimer updated:

  • Adds the eternal as a religion choice for Dionae.
  • Changes the Dionae blurb to be more up to date.

mikomyazaki updated:

  • Footstep animations from vision cones should now remove themselves a bit more promptly.

25 October 2020

Snakebittenn updated:

  • Adds some blindfolds to the loadout.

24 October 2020

Ferner updated:

  • Fixes some shuttles sometimes bringing bluespace turfs with them.
  • Fixed Icarus drones sometimes spawning indoors.
  • Fixed carp and Icarus drones not seeing in the dark.

Geeves updated:

  • Made some of the UI warnings more obvious (oxygen, pressure, temperature).
  • Replaced the chemical/tracking computer's HTML UI with a VueUI. It should feel a bit smoother now.
  • The computer in the armory area has been replaced with a proper modular console.

23 October 2020

Amunak updated:

  • End of round summary will now show antagonists as 'apprehended' if they end the round in brig or in cuffs (in 'regular' areas like station, centcom or shuttle) instead of 'fled the station'.
  • Added two area flags: PRISON and NO_CREW_EXPECTED. The former marks prison areas while the latter marks areas where crew is never present unless for extraordinary circumstances. They are used to detect brigged people and antag status at end of round.
  • Unified crew manifest pop-ups, made them all look nicer. Changed printed manifest format a bit.

Ferner updated:

  • Hostile mobs no longer attack turrets that aren't raised.

Geeves updated:

  • When you check yourself for injuries, you will now be able to feel if they contain shrapnel/implants.
  • Added various trash piles to maintenance, holding loot for anyone to discover.
  • Added a basic circuit kit to Tech Support to tinker with while no one visits the library.
  • The Tech Support card no longer bricks devices.
  • Wristbound sprites have been reverted, and their on-mob sprites have been removed.
  • Knives can now dig out implants as well, via the Extract Embedded right click verb.
  • Extracting embedded objects with a knife now deals damage to the specified organ.
  • The knife shrapnel removal menu now requires you to choose the specific external organ you're extracting from as well.
  • Implanting someone now visually reports to which organ you'll be doing so.
  • Added tracking slugs, shotgun rounds that contain tracking implants, to be shot into things.
  • Added a box of four tracking slugs to the armory. Allowed RnD to produce them as well.
  • Tracker implant IDs can no longer be configured, instead they spawn with their ID set to the correct next index.

JohnWildkins updated:

  • Renames Medical Resident to Medical Intern, lowers required age to 18.

Lady Fowl updated:

  • Stationbounds can no longer be flushed.

22 October 2020

Alberyk updated:

  • Removed roboticist alt titles.

Amunak updated:

  • SMES now show whether the maintenance hatch is open, they visibly show (in short range) that the hatch was opened/closed, and when open you can examine the SMES and see what coils are inside.
  • SMES coils, when examined closely, will now show a label with the charge capacity and I/O rating. Also tweaked descriptions of SMES coils and fixed some typos.
  • Added pretty listing of storage contents for ghosts. Applies to all bags, boxes, satchels, ... (every descendant of /obj/item/storage).

Ferner updated:

  • Ultra heavy kinetic accelerators can now only be used by unathi or other large mobs and the vaurca kinetic accelerator can only be used by vaurca.
  • Being thrown by sudden acceleration now also makes you fall over.
  • Moving a shuttle between two places that are both in close proximity to the station now takes a shorter amount of time than travelling to the station in the first place.

Geeves updated:

  • Ported various map effects from Virgo and Polaris, which can be used by mappers in the future to do cool things, such as portals, permanent lights, smoke emitters, screen shakers, and sound emitters.

The Stryker updated:

  • Adds a swept NanoTrasen skirt suit to the loadout under suit selection.
  • Adds two new lighters to the zippo collection: Gadpathur and Asoral.

21 October 2020

Alberyk, Kyres1 updated:

  • Added new sprites for the battle rifle and the naval shotgun.

Ferner updated:

  • The track laying rfd now fits in the suit storage of mining voidsuits and rigs.

Geeves updated:

  • Ethernet connections no longer allow computers to connect to an NTNet relay that's offline or doesn't exist.

JohnWildkins updated:

  • Hand labelers set 'on' will no longer go inside storage containers (backpacks, closets, crates), and will instead label them.

MattAtlas updated:

  • Nearsightedness has been fixed.

20 October 2020

Amunak updated:

  • Mapped (somewhat minimalistic) Telecomms, AI core, AI upload with robot charger + spawners and messaging server room to Runtime-2 for easier debugging of AI and radio related things. Also added most important consoles to bridge, some cameras and intercoms.

Geeves updated:

  • You can now examine C4 planted on walls to see when it detonates, you can also hit it with tools to access its wires.
  • C4 is no longer visible from the other side of the wall, instead its true location is where you're standing on the moment you plant it.
  • Planting C4 no longer forces you to touch the wall before the slap it down. It also doesn't play a dropping sound the moment you apply it.
  • You now only do the attack animation once you place the C4, instead of before the timer starts.

Geeves, Petrichor updated:

  • Added a canned unathi cider, Three Towns Cider, to the booze-o-mat.

JohnWildkins updated:

  • Large groups of images are now sent via spritesheets, improving performance gains. Currently used on goonchat accent icons.
  • Labels on an item no longer transfer their labeled name to collected clothing fibers.
  • Fixed certain accents having incorrect or missing icons in chat.

19 October 2020

Ferner updated:

  • The sensors of the remote warden's uniform now default to off and it can't be removed.

18 October 2020

Alberyk updated:

  • Fixed the spy bug's radio function. You can toggle broadcasting by using the bug while it is on the active hand.

Amunak updated:

  • Added pretty listing of closet contents for ghosts (incl. fullness and attached teleporter info).
  • Allows observers (ghosts) to follow all living things on restricted levels, which should allow for following exosuits and similar equipment.

Arrow768 updated:

  • Changes the CCIA Recorder, so it can be used to interview other ccia agents.

Ferner updated:

  • Odin bartenders and chefs that are tajara or unathi no longer spawn shoeless.

MattAtlas updated:

  • Improved the performance of one of the laggiest functions we use.

17 October 2020

Alberyk updated:

  • Phoron bolts no longer deal organ damage.
  • Fixed being unable to activate low light vision while cuffed.

Amunak updated:

  • Cigarette packs can now be opened and closed; they behave more like matchboxes and they spawn in closed. You cannot pull a cigarette out of a closed pack.
  • Fancy storage boxes will open before inserting anything.
  • Fancy storage boxes (donuts, matchboxes, ...) can no longer be opened/closed from anywhere - they require adjacency.
  • Other minor fixes to fancy storage boxes: sprites should behave better, stuff that shouldn't close doesn't close, etc.

The Stryker, Mwahahahaha updated:

  • Adds a Himeo voidsuit kit that can be used to reskin a mining suit into one to the loadout.

TheDocOct updated:

  • Increased round end time by 60 seconds to allow Odin ghost roles a bit more RP time. But not too much.

16 October 2020

Geeves updated:

  • Shields can now block simple mob attacks, such as carp and spiders, as long as the attack does less than 15 damage. You won't block juggernauts or spider queens.

JohnWildkins updated:

  • Moves firearm control sorting to clientside, hopefully alleviating issues.

TheDocOct updated:

  • Removes the depreciated crystal therapy pod and metronome room from the psychiatric ward of medical.

15 October 2020

JohnWildkins updated:

  • Minor backend tweaks to the firearm control program to hopefully narrow down reported issues.
  • Vending machines now have a graphical, icon-based item interface based in VueUI.
  • Vending machines now have a search bar.
  • Vending machines with large inventories (Booze-o-mat) should no longer cause excessive client lag.

Snakebittenn updated:

  • Adds kinetic analyzers, hand teleporters, gravity guns to the protolathe.
  • Adds brass knuckles to the autolathe's hacked section.
  • Removes RFDs from the autolathe, look in the protolathe.

14 October 2020

Alberyk, Happyfox updated:

  • Added a new Tajaran food and recipe: m'sai scout ration.
  • Added new items to Tajaran consular officers.
  • Changed Tajaran consular officer directives to be more of a guideline instead of objectives.

Geeves updated:

  • Added a super meat locker for admins to spawn, comes with all the ingredients needed for a grilling party.

MattAtlas updated:

  • pAIs can now actually use the atmospherics sensor program.

13 October 2020

Geeves updated:

  • Being inside something will no longer allow you to teleport through floors by attempting to move up or down a level.
  • Diona that spawn from cryo no longer have randomized names.

Wowzewow (Wezzy) updated:

  • Makes UI titles white again for better contrast.

12 October 2020

Alberyk updated:

  • Removed all medical alt titles with the exception of psychologist.

Arrow768 updated:

  • Added a number of ghostspawners to the odin.
  • Fixed a bug that caused all NT ghostspawners roles to have complete access to everything.
  • Reworked the access on the Odin.
  • The Odin now responds differently depending on the alert level present at transfer/evac.

Geeves updated:

  • Morphs now have HUDs, move intent, health, zone selection, resist.
  • Morphs now have the ability to put down flesh sac tendril nodes, gore nests, and toggle darkvision (the latter is in the abilities tab).
  • Morphs can now rest. Resting on flesh tendrils will heal them, albeit quite slowly.
  • Tendrils slow people walking over them down, unless they're a changeling.

JohnWildkins updated:

  • Camera monitoring is no longer available on tablets or wristbound computers.

11 October 2020

Alberyk updated:

  • Restricted what accents synthetics can mimic to be more lore friendly.
  • Fixed the sugar tree candy recipe not working properly

Caelphon updated:

  • Adds two new accents for Diona: Rootsong and Voidsong.
  • Removes the old diona accent.

Ferner updated:

  • The character preview now shows more than the first accessory in your loadout and you get equipped with them all at spawn if possible.

10 October 2020

Arrow768 updated:

  • Decreases the cargo shuttle move time.

Ferner updated:

  • Redesigned the layout of the research shuttle interior to be able to handle more passengers easily.

JohnWildkins updated:

  • Vending machines now have an icon-based item purchasing interface, based in VueUI.
  • Removed many hard references to PDAs / ID cards. There should be fewer situations where an ID-holding item isn't recognized as a valid ID.

09 October 2020

Ferner updated:

  • Fixes the ccia/rep and cargo shuttles getting cut off in transit.
  • Ives can no longer be summoned with a gold slime reaction.

Geeves updated:

  • Removed some stray white pixels on some borg sprites.
  • The choice to alter internal organs in character creation no longer appears if there are no internal organs to alter.
  • Vaurca can now choose to have robotic eyes.
  • Vaurca night eyes now work if they're robotic.
  • Added various sprites to grills. Added a grill recipe.
  • Fixed various bugs related to grills.

JohnWildkins updated:

  • Modular computer programs should now properly be assigned their parent computer on creation.

08 October 2020

Alberyk updated:

  • Fixed the colossal spider not changing sprites after using the Ceiling Climbing power.
  • Added a lore button at the title menu, it will allow players to read the summary of the current lore events and arcs.

JohnWildkins updated:

  • Admin spawn panel now opens at a larger resolution.

07 October 2020

Ferner updated:

  • Fixed the einstein engines uniform having no sprite.

Geeves updated:

  • Modular computers should now be slightly more responsive to user input, especially when killing programs on the main menu.
  • Updated assembly devices code and UIs. That includes signalers, timers, igniters, proximity sensors, infrared emitters, etc.
  • Fixes various bugs with infrared emitters, they can now properly be rotated.
  • Assemblies now properly disassemble without duplicating.
  • TCFL Helmets and RIG Helmets now come with cameras on the TCFL network, which can be viewed on the pilot's telescreen. Right click it and press Toggle Helmet Camera to access it.
  • Vaurca have gained night eyes similar to Tajara, but receive a blue filter instead of a monochrome one. They remain weak to flashes.
  • Vaurca no longer spawn with phoron inhalers.
  • The Crew Manifest now plays nice with quotes and apostrophes.

MattAtlas updated:

  • Vox have been completely removed from the game.

Snakebittenn updated:

  • Renames Illegal Research to Esoteric Research. Still hard to get, not illegal.
  • Bishop IPCs now have an extra language slot.
  • Adds a bunch more Kinetic Accelerator parts to the protolathe.

Wowzewow (Wezzy) updated:

  • Cap brims no longer cover one's eyes.
  • Loadout photos can fit in lockets and other storages now.
  • Lanyards can now be chosen alongside wallets.
  • Sweater underwear sprite has been fixed.
  • Security softcap colors have been reverted to match their uniforms.

06 October 2020

Alberyk updated:

  • Readded the appendicitis event.
  • Made the organ options in the character setup more modular; you can now spawn without an appendix and select more robotic organs.

Ferner updated:

  • Fixed the ship debris event spawning too many dead bodies and loot than originally intended.

FirinMaLazors updated:

  • Adds a mini bin in the medical lobby.
  • Fixed the hardcoded kebab and brain sandwhich recipes to let you use rods and brains, respectively, in recipes. Also fixed a recursion error in the variable recipes.
  • Compresses the size of the phonograph's music, space oddity and space asshole, and song_game, spaceserithi, and elevator.

Geeves updated:

  • Improved Icarus combat drone code across the board, added a non-malfunctioning variant.
  • The Icarus now sends combat drones to substantial space wildlife migrations.
  • Added an Icarus drone target painter to some admin roles. It is an orbital drop device that will warp two Icarus drones at the targetted location.
  • Added examine texts to malfunctioning combat drones that tells you what they're doing.
  • KAs no longer leave behind phantom projectiles that injure people.
  • KAs no longer recursively destroy rocks when one breaks, but still retain AoE effects.
  • KAs now have at least one tile of AoE on all modules.
  • Hand-teleporters have been made safer to use, they no longer teleport you in a radius around a beacon, but on top of it.
  • Hand-teles now have a text based indicator that shows you when it's ready for use.
  • Portals no longer have a random chance of failing per teleport, but have a random chance of starting destabilized. It will only be visually apparent after the first teleport.
  • Vaurca Breeder Ta now have their health icons properly centred.
  • Added the ability to ctrl and alt click vehicles to perform some actions.
  • Bike: Ctrl is Engine (only when kickstand is down), Alt is Kickstand
  • Train Engine / Pussywagon: Ctrl is Engine, Alt to take Keys

Geeves, Stryker updated:

  • Added an izweski hegemony flag to the kataphract equipment section.

05 October 2020

Alberyk updated:

  • Changeling lesser forms should have far less health and speed.
  • Fixed some bugs related to changeling using alternate forms and buckling.

Ferner updated:
